intro: Jasonia bocconei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, are often clustered in inflorescences at the tips of the stems. Jasonia bocconei thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
